Padded.name: Padded
Padded.description: This armor is made of several layers or tough cloth stuffed with padding

Robe.name: Padded
Robe.description: A very light robe. Covers your body, that's all

Leather.name: Leather
Leather.description: This armor is made of toughed animal skin. It's great protection for someone that wants to stay fully mobile.

Hide.name: Hide
Hide.description: This armor is made of animal skin, but usually still contains the thick fur. It's great for keeping the wearer warm and stopping weapons from finding purchase.

Chain shirt.name: Chain shirt
Chain shirt.description: A chain shirt comes with a steel cap.

Splint mail.name: Splint mail
Splint mail.description: This armor is made of long strips of metal, or tough wood, that hand vertically. The suit includes gauntlets.

Light gloves.name: Light gloves
Light gloves.description: Do not expect them to protect you from the cold.

Cestus.name: Cestus
Cestus.description: A reinforced gauntlet which protects the knuckles.

Leather gloves.name: Leather gloves
Leather gloves.description: A basic pair of leather gloves.

Metal gloves.name: Metal gloves
Metal gloves.description: Perfect to hit, uncomfy to wash your teeth

Armored bracers.name: Armored bracers
Armored bracers.description: A pair of heavy armor plated gloves that fit over the forearms and hands, that are good for bludgeoning. It's like strapping an anvil to your hand and punching someone in the face with it.

Light shoes.name: Light shoes
Light shoes.description: Simple shoes. Does not protect you from this little rock in your shoe.

Stuffed boots.name: Stuffed boots
Stuffed boots.description: Warm and nice, but not the best for the smell.

War boots.name: War boots
War boots.description: They are rusty, but will protect you. For some time. Little time.

Magician hat.name: Magician hat
Magician hat.description: The only protection is preventing your hair from burning with the flying candles

Fancy hat.name: Fancy hat
Fancy hat.description: You want everyone to know how fancy you are.
